comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: This picture was taken BEFORE they had trucks and roads that could get them a big Adirondack Tree

comment._content:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Interestingly, in most of these photographs of the tree-raising in Madison Square, there are, in fact, people in the tree either tying or releasing ropes.  They are only visible if you view the larger digital files over at the Library of Congress website by following the link at Persistent URL above.  Quite a job!

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
And here I had figured that "learning the ropes" was only a seafaring term!

Aye, aye Cap'n! Ahoy and avast! Batten down the mizzenmast!
